events.title: Russo-Japanese War ends
events.summary: Treaty of Portsmouth shifts balance in East Asia.
events.punchline: When a rising power speed-checks an empire.

events.title: 1914 Balkan alliances trigger WWI
events.summary: European empires chain-react into war because nobody reads treaties.

events.title: 1915 Armenian Genocide
events.summary: Ottoman Empire orders mass deportation and extermination of Armenians.
events.punchline: One and a half million erased from history.

events.title: Russian Revolution
events.summary: Bolsheviks seize power; USSR emerges.

events.title: Weimar Constitution adopted
events.summary: Germany becomes a republic after WWI.

events.title: League of Nations established
events.summary: Attempt at collective security post-WWI.

events.title: 1928 Soviet Gulag system founded
events.summary: Forced labor camps imprison millions for decades.

events.title: Hitler becomes Chancellor
events.summary: Totalitarian regime consolidates power.

events.title: Spanish Civil War begins
events.summary: Proxy battleground of ideologies.

events.title: 1936 Spanish Civil War becomes warm-up for WW2
events.summary: Germany & USSR test weapons in Spain like demo day.

events.title: 1937 Nanking Massacre
events.summary: Japanese troops slaughter up to 300,000 Chinese civilians in six weeks.
events.punchline: City of life turned into open grave.

events.title: 1942 Bataan Death March
events.summary: Japanese force 75,000 POWs on brutal 65-mile trek; thousands die.

events.title: 1945 Firebombing of Dresden
events.summary: Allied bombers incinerate German city killing ~25,000 civilians.

events.title: United Nations founded
events.summary: Global forum for peace and security.

events.title: India independence
events.summary: End of British rule; partition creates Pakistan.

events.title: State of Israel declared
events.summary: War of 1948 follows declaration.
events.punchline: Birth certificate with immediate neighbors' review.

events.title: 1950 Korean War
events.summary: North backed by USSR/China, South backed by USA/UN — draw with millions dead.

events.title: ECSC formed
events.summary: Coal & Steel community integrates European industries.

events.title: 1956 Suez Crisis
events.summary: Britain, France & Israel attack Egypt — USA shuts it down.
events.punchline: Britain learns it’s no longer the boss.

events.title: Treaty of Rome
events.summary: Creates the EEC and Euratom.

events.title: 1958–1962 Great Chinese Famine
events.summary: Mao’s policies lead to starvation of 15–45 million.

events.title: 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis
events.summary: USSR puts nukes in Cuba, US blockades island, world nearly ends over chess move.

events.title: Cuban Missile Crisis
events.summary: U.S.-USSR standoff brings world near nuclear war.

events.title: 1965 US intervenes in Dominican Republic
events.summary: Marines land to stop ‘communism’ — really to protect insurance companies.

events.title: 1968 Biafra secession war
events.summary: Nigeria backed by UK crushes breakaway Biafra — 1M starve.

events.title: 1968 Mỹ Lai Massacre
events.summary: US soldiers kill hundreds of Vietnamese civilians; cover-up follows.

events.title: Prague Spring crushed
events.summary: Warsaw Pact invades Czechoslovakia.

events.title: 1968 Vietnam Tet Offensive
events.summary: Communist surprise attacks shock US public — war turns unpopular.

events.title: 1971 Bangladesh Liberation War atrocities
events.summary: Pakistani army kills up to 3 million civilians.
events.punchline: Birth of nation bathed in blood.

events.title: PRC seat at UN
events.summary: People's Republic of China takes China seat at UN.

events.title: 1972 Bloody Sunday, Northern Ireland
events.summary: British paratroopers shoot unarmed protestors in Derry.

events.title: 1974 Portugal Carnation Revolution
events.summary: Dictatorship ends bloodlessly with flowers in gun barrels.

events.title: 1975 Cambodian Killing Fields
events.summary: Pol Pot’s regime murders ~2 million Cambodians under Year Zero.

events.title: 1976 Soweto Uprising
events.summary: South African police kill protesting black students during apartheid.

events.title: Iranian Revolution
events.summary: Monarchy falls; Islamic Republic established.

events.title: 1979 Sandinistas overthrow Somoza
events.summary: Marxists take power → USA vows revenge through Contras.
events.punchline: Out with dictator, in with ‘freedom fighters’.

events.title: 1982 Falklands War
events.summary: UK and Argentina fight over cold sheep islands.

events.title: 1986 US bombs Libya (Operation El Dorado Canyon)
events.summary: Reagan strikes Gaddafi after Berlin nightclub terror link.
events.punchline: Message sent: don’t annoy the sheriff.

events.title: 1988 Halabja chemical attack
events.summary: Iraqi forces gas Kurdish civilians killing 5,000.

events.title: Berlin Wall falls
events.summary: Symbolic end of Cold War division.

events.title: 1989 Berlin Wall falls
events.summary: Cold War ends — NATO celebrates, Russia drinks vodka in confusion.
events.punchline: One wall down, many NATO bases up.

events.title: 1989 Tiananmen Square crackdown
events.summary: Chinese tanks crush pro-democracy protests in Beijing.

events.title: 1991 Gulf War led by USA
events.summary: Iraq invades Kuwait; NATO-aligned coalition smashes Saddam in 100 hours.

events.title: Dissolution of USSR
events.summary: Fifteen independent states emerge.

events.title: 1992–1995 Siege of Sarajevo
events.summary: Bosnian Serb forces shell civilians for nearly four years.

events.title: Maastricht Treaty
events.summary: EU foundation treaty signed.

events.title: 1994 First Chechen War
events.summary: Russia bombs its own territory to keep it — NATO watches awkwardly.

events.title: Rwandan Genocide
events.summary: Mass atrocities over ~100 days.

events.title: 1994 Rwanda Genocide
events.summary: Hutu militias slaughter Tutsis with machetes in 100 days.

events.title: 1993–1995 Srebrenica massacres
events.summary: UN safe zone in Bosnia fails; over 8,000 Muslim men killed.

events.title: 1998 Kosovo crackdown before NATO strike
events.summary: Serb forces massacre villages — NATO prepares justice mission.

events.title: September 11 attacks
events.summary: Coordinated terrorist attacks in the U.S.

events.title: 2001 Macedonia ethnic conflict
events.summary: Ethnic tensions erupt; Macedonian forces clash with Albanian uprising over rights and autonomy.

events.title: 2002 Gujarat Riots
events.summary: Hindu mobs kill over 1,000 Muslims while police accused of standing by.

events.title: 2003 Iraq Shock & Awe
events.summary: US-led bombing campaign flattens Baghdad; invasion follows.

events.title: 2004 Beslan school massacre
events.summary: Chechen militants take 1,100 hostages; Russian forces storm — 334 killed, mostly children.

events.title: EU expands to 10 states
events.summary: Largest single enlargement round.

events.title: 2005 London 7/7 Bombings
events.summary: Four suicide bombers attack transit system; 52 killed.

events.title: 2006 East Timor unrest
events.summary: Mutiny and factional violence lead to Australian-led military intervention.

events.title: 2006 Israel–Hezbollah War
events.summary: Proxy mess: Iran backs Hezbollah, NATO backs Israel quietly.
events.punchline: Militia vs Air Force — ends in stalemate.

events.title: 2007 Kenya post-election violence
events.summary: Tribal clashes after contested vote kill over 1,000.

events.title: 2008 Drone warfare escalates
events.summary: US starts killing militants remotely in Pakistan & Yemen.

events.title: 2008 Gaza War (Operation Cast Lead)
events.summary: Israel launches heavy bombing in Gaza killing 1,400 Palestinians.

events.title: 2008 Russo–Georgian War
events.summary: Five-day war over South Ossetia; Russia asserts dominance.
events.punchline: EU negotiates ceasefire; Kremlin keeps territory.

events.title: 2009 Sri Lanka final assault on LTTE
events.summary: Government forces kill thousands of Tamil civilians in last offensive.

events.title: 2010 France expands Chad military base
events.summary: Paris claims anti-terror mission; critics say uranium guarding mission.

events.title: Arab Spring
events.summary: Waves of protests across the Arab world.

events.title: 2011 Syrian Civil War starts
events.summary: Protests escalate into brutal, multi-sided war with chemical weapons and sieges.

events.title: 2012 Mali coup and Tuareg rebellion
events.summary: Soldiers overthrow president; north seized by rebels and Islamists.

events.title: 2013 Rabaa Massacre in Egypt
events.summary: Military kills ~1,000 pro-Morsi protestors in single day.

events.title: 2014 Boko Haram kidnaps Chibok girls
events.summary: 276 Nigerian schoolgirls abducted — sparking global outrage.
events.punchline: #BringBackOurGirls goes viral — girls mostly never returned.

events.title: Russia annexes Crimea
events.summary: Unrecognized annexation condemned internationally.

events.title: 2014 Gaza war — Operation Protective Edge
events.summary: 50-day conflict kills 2,200 Palestinians and 73 Israelis.

events.title: 2014 Yemen civil war begins
events.summary: Saudi-led coalition bombs Houthis with US/UK weapons.
events.punchline: Worst humanitarian crisis, best arms sales.

events.title: 2015 Russia enters Syria war
events.summary: Putin bombs opposition; West backs rebels — peace becomes meme.

events.title: 2015 Saudi-led air campaign in Yemen begins
events.summary: Coalition bombs Houthis; hospitals, schools, and weddings hit.

events.title: Brexit referendum
events.summary: UK votes to leave the European Union.
events.punchline: Taking your ball and going home.

events.title: 2016 Orlando nightclub shooting
events.summary: Gunman kills 49 at LGBTQ nightclub in deadliest US terror attack since 9/11.

events.title: 2016 Failed coup in Turkey
events.summary: Military tries removing Erdogan — NATO stays silent until winner is clear.

events.title: 2017 ISIS-linked Marawi siege
events.summary: Islamist militants occupy Philippine city — 5-month urban battle.

events.title: 2017 Qatar blockade
events.summary: Saudi & UAE isolate Qatar — US sides with everyone depending on base.
events.punchline: Allies fight — US sells all sides weapons.

events.title: 2017 Rohingya ethnic cleansing
events.summary: Myanmar military burns villages forcing 700k Rohingya into exile.
events.punchline: Drive them out — deny it later.

events.title: 2018 Azov Battalion controversy
events.summary: NATO nations arm Ukraine while denying far-right units exist.

events.title: 2019 Hong Kong protests
events.summary: Millions demonstrate against extradition law; China imposes security act.

events.title: 2019 Mali spiral despite NATO training
events.summary: Western-trained forces collapse — jihadists grow stronger.

events.title: 2019 Sudan Khartoum Massacre
events.summary: Security forces kill over 100 pro-democracy protesters at sit-in.
events.punchline: Calls for freedom met with bullets.

events.title: Abraham Accords
events.summary: Normalization agreements between Israel and Arab states.
events.punchline: Middle East patch notes: surprising stability buffs.

events.title: 2020 Belarus mass protests
events.summary: Election fraud allegations spark uprising; regime responds with brutality.

events.title: 2020 Ethiopia–Tigray conflict
events.summary: Ethiopian forces and Eritrean allies accused of massacres, rape, starvation tactics.

events.title: 2020 Nagorno-Karabakh war
events.summary: Azerbaijan uses Turkish drones, Armenia cries to Russia and France.

events.title: 2020 Lekki Toll Gate shooting (EndSARS protests)
events.summary: Nigerian army accused of firing on peaceful anti-police brutality protesters.

events.title: 2021 Myanmar military coup
events.summary: Army seizes power, shoots protesters, internet blackout.

events.title: 2021 Colombia tax reform protests
events.summary: Police crackdown on protesters opposing unpopular austerity tax.

events.title: 2022 Taliban bans Afghan girls from education
events.summary: New Taliban regime reverses women’s basic rights post-US withdrawal.

events.title: 2022 China-Solomon Islands pact alarms NATO
events.summary: Beijing signs Pacific security deal — West panics over new ‘Island power’.

events.title: 2022 NATO cyber command expanded
events.summary: Alliance readies for digital war — still uses Windows XP in offices.

events.title: 2022 Russia full-scale invasion of Ukraine
events.summary: Tanks roll across border; cities bombed; NATO arms revenge.

events.title: Full-scale invasion of Ukraine
events.summary: Major European war returns; global alignment shifts.

events.title: 2023 Gaza escalation
events.summary: Israel responds to Hamas attack with unprecedented bombing campaign.
